details.title: Structure synthesis of prospective technical systems
details.abstract: For the creation of competitive products in aerospace, It Is necessary to synthesize from 50 to 150 new engineering solutions. The method of structural synthesis of new systems to solve two problems is examined: 1) Directproblems. After the creation of the morphological array with the help of clusterization, a search of engineering solutions occurs. 2) Inverse problems. The effective search near existing solutions is carried out. The operation of the method is given in three examples: Supertight Re-entry Vehicles, HAPs, and adaptive acoustic systems.
details.journal_title: IEEE Aerospace and Electronic Systems Magazine
